name: Swift Files
tagline: A simple application that shows how manipulate plist and plain text files.
body:
## Hello o/
### I'm Francis :3

I'm and a Computing Engineering student at the [Instituto Federal de Educação, Ciência e Tecnologia do Ceará] (http://fortaleza.ifce.edu.br).

Also, I'm in touch with some kinds of technologies and programming languages, mainly Objective-C and Swift. :heart:

Then, I decided to share some acquired knowledges using my repositories on Github. In my free time, I'll build some little apps that illustrates some aspects of iOS development. :D

So, I hope you like it. :smiley:

## This Project

This project demonstrates how you can handle plain text and plist files in iOS.

On the truth, the main idea of this project comes from an class exercise I'd done in Objective-C when I was first learning how to program for iOS.

## Features

* Create a plist or plain text file
* Update a plist or plain text file
* Read a plist or plain text file
* Delete a plist or plain text file

## Main Knowledges

* iOS Sandbox
* iOS Directories Structure
* NSFileManager
* NSKeyedArchiver and NSKeyedUnarchiver

## Technologies

* Swift 2.0
* iOS 9.2
